data.description: Job Description:The DepartmentStrategic Advisors Inc. (SAI) Business Strategy and Execution provides value to SAI by helping drive better business decisions, align against a shared strategy, accelerate and execute key initiatives and ensure seamless business operations. Strategic Advisers, Inc. (SAI) is a registered investment adviser responsible for providing retail and workplace managed account solutions, and guidance and planning methodologies. The Intern will determine how/if Strategic Advisers Business Oversight can enhance our analytic capabilities to advance a forward-looking framework.Responsibilities• Daily projects will include Machine Learning, AI, Data Querying, Analysis & Profiling, Data Mining, Analytics, and Data Visualization.• As a member of the SAI team, the intern will work on various innovation projects contributing to the success of the department.Experience and Education• Currently enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program, all majors are welcome.• Demonstrated interest and exposure to Machine Learning, Data Analytics, Visualization using Tableau, AI/ML using Python.Skills and Knowledge• Experience with Tableau, SQL, Python.• Experience with Excel, Word, PPT, Advanced Excel skills: V-lookup, pivot tables, macros, etc.• Leadership involvement at school.• Self-starter, intellectual curiosity• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Location: Boston, MAInternship Dates: June 1, 2026 – August 7, 2026The base salary range for this position is $20 - $32 per hour.Placement in the range will vary based on job responsibilities and scope, geographic location, candidate’s relevant experience, and other factors.Note, the application window closes when the position is filled or unposted.Fidelity’s hybrid working model blends the best of both onsite and offsite work experiences. Working onsite is important for our business strategy and our culture. We also value the benefits that working offsite offers associates. Most hybrid roles require associates to work onsite every other week (all business days, M-F) in a Fidelity office.Please be advised that Fidelity’s business is governed by the provisions of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, the Investment Advisers Act of 1940, the Investment Company Act of 1940, ERISA, numerous state laws governing securities, investment and retirement-related financial activities and the rules and regulations of numerous self-regulatory organizations, including FINRA, among others. Those laws and regulations may restrict Fidelity from hiring and/or associating with individuals with certain Criminal Histories.Certifications:Category:Administration
